title: 111_hr1805
content: The "American Working Families Tax Relief Act of 2009" makes the state and local sales tax deduction permanent and also makes the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses permanent. The Act makes the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses permanent, along with treating mortgage insurance premiums as interest and expanding the homebuyer credit. The Act expands the homebuyer credit by amending the Internal Revenue Code to extend the deadline to December 31, 2009, and removing the requirement for first-time homebuyers. The Act expands the homebuyer credit by amending the Internal Revenue Code to extend the deadline to December 31, 2009, and removing the requirement for first-time homebuyers. Section 36 of the Code is amended to change the heading from "first-time homebuyer credit" to "home purchase credit." The table of sections is also updated accordingly. The home purchase credit under the Internal Revenue Code is modified to extend the deadline to December 31, 2009, and remove the first-time homebuyer requirement. Amendments include changing the heading to "home purchase credit" and updating the recapture rules. The recapture rules for the home purchase credit under the Internal Revenue Code are amended if the taxpayer disposes of the principal residence before the end of the recapture period. The recapture rules for the home purchase credit under the Internal Revenue Code are amended by redesignating Section 36(f)(3) and making various changes to paragraphs (1) and (2) within the code. The recapture rules for the home purchase credit under the Internal Revenue Code are amended by redesignating Section 36(f)(3) and making changes to paragraphs (1) and (2). Amendments include striking certain paragraphs and inserting new ones, with effective dates specified for each change. The amendments made by this Act modify the recapture rules for the home purchase credit, taking effect as if included in a previous Act from 2008.
